intro: Hieracium soleirolianum, commonly known as the Soleirolian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
